turns.content: how many games are in the regular season?

In Major League Baseball (MLB), there are typically 162 games in the regular season for each team. The regular season usually starts in late March or early April and runs through late September or early October. However, the exact schedule can vary slightly from year to year due to factors such as weather-related postponements and adjustments to the calendar to accommodate events such as the World Baseball Classic.

The MLB offseason is the period of time between the end of the World Series, which usually takes place in late October or early November, and the start of spring training, which usually begins in mid to late February. During the offseason, teams focus on roster changes, such as trades and free agent signings, and also conduct other business operations such as player contract negotiations and scouting for the upcoming season. The MLB offseason is an important time for teams to improve their rosters and prepare for the next season.
